H0.text: What type of art does the English artist Banksy specialize in. Street Art

H1.text: What type of art does the English artist Banksy specialize in. Muralism

H2.text: What type of art does the English artist Banksy specialize in. Urban Art

H3.text: What type of art does the English artist Banksy specialize in. Grafitti

A4.text: Banksy is one of the world's most notorious and popular street artists who continues to remain faceless in today's society.

A5.text: He is known for his political, anti-war stencil art mainly in Bristol, England.

A6.text: British street artist Banksy visited the city in 2000 and inspired many to take their art to the streets.

A7.text: Street art has received artistic recognition with the high‑profile status of Banksy and other artists.

A8.text: Banksy’s first known large wall mural was The Mild Mild West painted in 1997 to cover advertising of a former solicitors' office on Stokes Croft in Bristol.

A9.text: He started as a freehand graffiti artist in 1990–1994 as one of Bristol's DryBreadZ Crew (DBZ), with two other artists known as Kato and Tes.

A10.text: Police thwart attempt to steal Bethlehem Banksy mural

A11.text: Banksy Stencils on Resuable Mylar - Graffiti Stencils of Banksy Art

A12.text: Art supporters endorse his work distributed in urban areas as pieces of art

A13.text: Banksy's art is a prime example of the classic controversy: vandalism vs. art

A14.text: Urban artists like Banksy have gained mainstream status.

A15.text: A confirmation of street art's new mainstream status can be, in part, confirmed by an invitation from the Tate calling upon artists to create outdoor pieces on the Thames side of the gallery in the summer of 2008.

A16.text: graffiti and street art have played a key role in contemporary wall painting.
